answers.answer: It's not true that the baby will weigh what you or the baby's father weighed at birth..
Yea soneone said it should  be around the same as the parents

Remember it's an estimate.  Sometimes the baby is long and they estimate more weight than is actually there.  My SIL was very long. They told my MIL that she was going to be 9 pounds, ended up just over 7.If you have gestational diabetes or other complications it could effect the baby's weight.But I have also heard that your baby should be about the same weight as the parents were.
That isn't true. I weighed 6lbs 6oz and my fiancé was 6lbs 13oz our son was 9lbs 8oz
Yea that's not true.. it depends on your pregnancy and the baby's development. And WHEN they are born. Eg. Premature, on Time or late

Yea my due date sunday and i have a appointment monday to schedule to b induced . it was a lady that said that n said its inheritage thats why he estimating 8 pounds and me n my child father was born at 6 pounds i never heard of that

question: Where does babies in the womb get their weight from? Like i was told your kids are suppose to weigh around the same as u or the father during birth me and my child father was both 6 pounds but doctor telling me my baby is bout 7 n half 8 pounds now and they are inducing me on the 17th
title: Babies weigh at birth
